snippet: Some people close to Justin Ross Harris are having a hard time believing he killed his son, even as Georgia officials detailed the bizarre actions of Mr. Harris and his wife on the day the boy died.
abstract: Some residents in Tuscaloosa, Ala, Justin Ross Harris' hometown, are finding it difficult to believe that he could have murdered his own son, Cooper; friends and acquaintances say they do not believe that he was capable of killing a child to regain his sense of freedom; authorities have charged him with felony murder after his toddler son died from being left in a hot car.

byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER
byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Tuscaloosa, and Alan Blinder from Marietta, Ga. Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Some people close to Justin Ross Harris are having a hard time believing he killed his son, even as Georgia officials detailed the bizarre actions of Mr. Harris and his wife on the day the boy died.

headline.main: Examining a Father’s Role in a Toddler’s Death
headline.print_headline: Examining a Father’s Role in a Toddler’s Death
